text:
I hate to give this place 1 star but my recent experiences were horrible. I use to dine at this restaurant often with my family. The more we go, service decreased. Our water cups never get filled.

The very last time I was there, I found a gnat in my pho. Although I have eaten about 50% of the medicore pho, they asked if I wanted another bowl. I said no; I was there on my lunch break. No time to wait for another bowl. I got up to pay for my bill and to my surprise, there was no discount or any sort of accommodation. 

I am disappointed with them and will not be back.
Excellent fresh food and fast friendly service.  The number 55 was awesome!  Decent prices and a nice atmosphere.  Highly recommended.

This place was delightful. I've only had pho a few times in my life but this place did not disappoint. I had read several reviews about this place saying 'the decor was mundane, etc' yet I thought it was very nice. It was about what I expected. Clean. Tastefully decorated. The staff was kind and stopped by the table several times to see if we needed anything. 

I ordered the beef pho and it was delightful. I plan to branch out next time I visit.
Pho broth is not the best and the meat is too tough! Staff is nice but We won't go back.

The food is always great and fesh. Our family have dinner here every weekend. My favorite one is beef PHO. Most the staffs are nice and polite. The funny story is when I saw there was a rude family , they did not eat there but they sat the baby on the restaurant's table, seems like they about to feed the baby or change the diaper the server was nice to ask what would they like but they pissed off and yelled out loud LMAO

I love this place for Pho. I generally dont order anything else because the food is average. However, the noodle soups, Pho, is awesome. 

One must take advantage of the extra ingredients and the sauces to make the soup "snap"! Otherwise, first timers may think the soup is bland.

My favorite dish here would be pho Dac biet n the beef rice plate, customers service is great, they have new owner now so I don't go as much n I don't tip because the owner keep the tip which is wrong. I like the old owner better so even though is close to my house I won't be going here much.

I went in here for a quick smoothie and I have mixed feelings about this place! I came in and notice the place was slightly dirty, so I ordered my pineapple smoothie and it took a pretty long time to get! The blender was really loud!!!! When I got my smoothie and left I soon returned because there were little hot balls of something in my drink. When I went to them and asked them what it was they said it was boba? They gladly redid my order to what I wanted. I wouldn't want to come again though.

I've tried pretty much all the Vietnamese from all over the valley. Spending so much time in Cali and with my Asian friends spoiled me and it's hard to find a decent Pho spot that makes it right.

Everyone who has been to the spots in Tempe knows that it's always watered down and has no flavor. Pholicious seems to get it right.

It's very much a mom and pop spot, you come in seat yourself. The staff is always friendly and the place is clean.

The menu has something for everyone, but I'm always going to recommend the Pho with oxtail to anyone who asks. Prices are affordable and if you aren't info Pho, they have all the traditional dishes you'd expect.

They added a yogurt shop to it a few months ago so you can always try that if you're not into Boba or any of the traditional deserts.

Do not go to Pholicious.  The food is tasteless and completely overdone.  Their cleanliness standards are not up to par (i.e. pest control).  The service was among the slowest I've received in a long time.  A loud video game theme song played throughout my meal. Random and annoying. 

The wait staff and management are very courteous, but this does not justify wasting your money on Pholicious.

This place went from being my favorite Pho place to my least. The last 2 times I've ordered from here my food has been gross. First, dirty vegetables. Second, cold broth. It seems like the kitchen staff just doesn't care anymore!

I am not one of those phonnoisseurs, but I do know a decent plate of Lemongrass Tofu, and this was GOOD.  My eyes rolled toward the heavens every time I took a bite. It had spice. It had red peppers too.

I also ordered the vegetarian spring rolls, which came with a yummy peanut sauce.

The place was clean and we were ushered to a booth- yay!

The service was fast, even though we did get the very last booth.

The decor was a bit over the top but eh whatev. At least it wasn't pretentious. I'd much rather think something is cute, even quaint, than have to look at that naked atrocity some dumbass calls art at *arly's.
Love this place, it's on our dinner rotation. The owners and wait staff always greet us since we are regulars. Great place and cheap too. Try the #100 its the best ever.

Mall food is usually sub-par, however Southpark Mall seems to have above-average food venues. Pholicious only reinforces this trend.

I don't want to write a drawn out review, so I'll just mention that their menu is very simple. Pho dishes with a variety of proteins (beef, chicken, shrimp, fish) that come in "regular" and "large" sizes, prices varying from $6.50-8.50. They have a few appetizers in the form of spring/egg rolls. They also have bubble tea. That's pretty much it. 

Their food is very good, the broth excellent. The pho comes with all the usual staples that you can opt to throw in (bean sprout, onion, lime slice, chili peppers), as well as sriracha sauce and hoison sauce.

I mean, that's basically it. But it's very GOOD, and very DIFFERENT.

I'd give them a 5-star but I'll wait until trying their bubble tea, spring rolls, and other protein options. As is, everything I've tried so far has been indicative of a 5-star rating, though.

This is not the best Pho in town. It is at best just alright. The service is some of the worst I've seen. They rush you to put in your order. You are served a glass of water and good luck getting anything else to drink. I ordered pork fried rice and never got it. When it was time to pay the pork fried rice was on my bill. The guy was very rude when I told him I never got my rice and wasn't paying for it. Don't waste your money in this place.

First visit here and I'll be back for more.

The Good:

Rich tasting Pho soup, did not have a greasy taste like. 
Fast/friendly service and very polite people.
Food was exceptional and fresh.
Price was just about right.
Interesting layout inside, especially the ceiling, pretty cool design
Clean Restaurant and professional looking.
Owner/s speak "fluent english" and reason im bringing this up is because other Pho restaurants I been to, I have come across non english waiters serving my food.

The Bad: (can be improved)

We did not recieve a refill or was asked. 
Did not come to our table as needed after meal and drinks was served.
After our check was brought, we were not asked if we needed anything else.
We were given very small amounts of stem of basil and 2 pieces of small lemons.

All in all, we had a fun experience here and the food was good.

I had the (Sua Dau Xanh) - MungBean Milk Beverage, it was okay.

Will try (Sinh To) milk shake next time.
So delicious. Definitely coming back. Great food, great prices, great atmosphere. I have nothing to complain about except that I don't have a bigger stomach.

We've ate at almost every pho restaurant in town and this was by far the worst. We both ordered the flank steak and brisket pho. The meat looked like a part of a stomach, it was so suspect we picked it out and asked for more brisket to replace it. Don't order the "flank" or whatever they're calling that meat. It's horrifying to me that they are even feeding that to people. I am uploading the pic we snapped of the meat, it's the yellowish brown pile of crap.

Weird space.  Small.  Cramped.  Sloppy on the inside.  Odd heating elements on floor to heat things.  This looks less like a franchise and more like someone set up a restaurant in a hurry and without an actual plan.  Drink machine is broken.  When I first looked at the broth as I sat to eat it, my first thought was that that it looked like old dish water, a sentiment echoed by my wife when she saw it.  Taste was a bit bland.  Lime was not great looking, but sprouts and cilantro were fine.  I didn't finish it.  It's mall food, true, but it's like they don't really care.

Worst viet food ever. Don't even think it needs to be labeled "Vietnamese". Pho is very pricey and no flavor at all. I came in and order spring rolls and egg rolls and was disappointed. Worst I've ever had. The viet sub they had was a big fail too. Let's just say, save your money and time and drive down the road to Saigon bay for some real viet food that's worth your money!

I'm not one to do these kinds of reviews, however, I felt the need to tell everyone my experience in this restaurant. Let's just say it was horrible. I ordered the shrimp pho and it tasted so plain and shrimp fixing taste like shrimp and the rest of the soup was so plain. You could really taste the water. I also ordered some Fried rolls and they didn't have much flavor. I went to the bathrooms and the floor looked like it hadn't been cleaned in 5 weeks. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone.

I ordered some to go beef pho from here. When I got home and opened the boxes I saw that they put the raw beef with all the fixings (sprouts, onions, rice noodles, etc.), and I was skeptical at first. I quickly added the beef to the broth to "cook" it, along with the rest of the ingredients. I ended up with some really delicious pho. I was very pleased. I will definitely be back!

Walked in at noon on a Sunday when it opened.  I was told it would take about ten minutes for the broth for the Pho to be ready. Ten minutes later I was told another 15 minutes.  We didn't  get our food until 12:40.  It's in the food court and they need to have it ready when it opens.  Most other food court places open at 11am.  The chicken in the PHO tasted like frozen microwave chicken pieces. The broth tasted fine. The herb bags had more stems and less herbs.  Missing the Thai basil.

Haven't been here in awhile so we decided to come here tonight and I must say, it was delicious! They give you just the perfect amount of food. We will definitely be back. Everyone is so nice and friendly. Very good customer service.

Excellent, fast, friendly service and great prices. If you want to try a new place, pick this one. The menu has a large selection and the staff is willing to explain any menu item that you have not tried before. They are even willing to give chop-stick training to you! (I still failed!).

They deliver, but it's a great place to relax and enjoy great food in a friendly atompshere.  Very clean also. 

Try the beef, ribs and/or egg rolls. The rice is the best. I recommend taking a group and getting a ton of different items and trying them all.

Second time here. Was here for the first time before I moved here a week ago and ordered takeout. Was pretty good at that time and decided to come back after moving to AZ and living closeby.

Place is clean and large.

Pho was good, Broth was rich, somewhat slim on the meat-side but pretty-much on-par with most pho places I've been to all around the country and Canada. Overall for pho, a place I'd go back to, meets all expectations but doesn't exceed them anywhere, which is fine by me. I'm just happy this place is close to my home and I can go whenever I want, and its good food.

This is the worst place ever to eat at. I wanted a bubble tea with coconut and taro mix together but the manger said I couldn't but I could mix strawberry and mango. Like wtf? You won't let me mix coconut and taro but your going to let me mix strawberry and mango. So I decided to get coconut and let me tell you, it was the worst bubble tea I've ever had. It tasted really plain with no flavor and it wasn't even a smoothie, it tasted more like ice and it wasn't blended really well. I was going to order pho but Realize the price for their pho is already the price of a regular size bowl of pho at the restaurant. I place an order for egg rolls and it took longer then it was suppose to be. I am really disappointed and I will not come back to this place. Also, what manger is going to talk on the phone in front of their customers while standing at the cash register. Did I mention, they don't serve egg roll sauce, instead he gave me duck sauce.

We have stopped coming to Pholicious since the last time we came in I received super oily chicken pho (I uploaded a pic). It was difficult to eat,  and whereas I usually drink a good portion of the broth after I finish the noodles, I couldn't stand it this time. It seems like there's different staff every time we come in as well. The rolls and other items we order are still really good, but you can't call yourself Pholicious if your pho sucks. What a shame.

Best Vietnamese food in the west valley!  Price is right too, and the owner and young servers are friendly.  Try number 52 for a special treat.  Includes beef,shrimp,egg roll, noodles and salad greens and sprouts with a dipping sauce. 
 Even served  cleverly in a boat.  Lots of flavor, very fresh....and we are picky.

I have eaten here once when they had just opened. I was in the mood for a rice dish, so I ordered the combination rice plate. Dissappointly, they brought it out late considering nobody was there except me. And to make it worse, the food was cold!???meats were'nt marinated enough, and sliced very thin. it looked like a kids rice plate.   I told the owner, and he went to the kitchen to confirm if they had served me cold food. Of course they said no, so he thought it would be good business to give me a measly 10% off. Wow!! I should have listened to all my friends who told me not to eat here, because their food isn't good. But I wanted to be the judge for myself and man are they right! I'm vietnamese and like trying out the new Viet restaurants, but this is off my list for good.
The pho is good, but I really love the crepes, I think it is called bành xèo can.   Just ask for the crepe, can't go wrong.

My first time trying pho.... It was so pholicious. Immediately seated and order taken, drinks were brought promptly. There was only one thing that I didn't like.....the spray they wash their tables with. Over powering smell of fabulouso, I could taste it! Luckily she wasn't cleaning while I was eating. I will return!

I cannot for the life of me understand how this place is empty at any time if the day. I went with my family for lunch and we during was so delicious that nobody spoke once the food arrived, they just ate. That's seriously never happened before. My boys loved the chicken and rice from the kids' menu and their won ton soup was heavenly. The staff was quick and attentive and the bathroom was clean. We don't get out to this area very often, but this will be our spot whenever we do!

My husband and I had never had pho before.  We'd decided on this place because it is right up the street andfriends reccomended it.  Family owned restaurant and we were very pleasantly surprised.  The chili fish sauce wings weren't AMAZING!  And the shrimp pho rocked. Only gripe, if there was anything is the amount of shrimp and size.  However, the complexity of the broth and overall taste of soup over rode anybody downs regarding the shrimp.  It was definatley enough, I just like bigger shrimp.  We will definately be back!

Here I go. First off, I feel this if the best pho on the west side. I've tried them all. The broth is not at all bland like some of the reviews state. IT'S PERFECT!! The owner is a very nice man, always waves when I walk in & that's good enough for me. The spring rolls are awesome. I think what some people are use to is how some other places put oil on their noodles, that right there will give it flavor. I myself workout & eat healthy so I'm really conscious what I eat. If you're looking for pho loaded with MSG or broth that taste like sugar water, then this isn't your place. If you're looking for a healthy bowl of pho then this is your spot. This is my opinion & I will only eat here for a bowl of pho....its a 25 min drive from my house but well worth it.......FYI, I can't speak for their other dishes, only their pho......Thanks for reading!

Great Pho and egg rolls! We come back regularly and have eaten our fair share of Pho around the valley. The staff is always attentive and the establishment is clean. It is busier each time we come back, that speaks for itself. It is family owned, and the owner is always trying to please everyone that walks in the door. I have had the chicken and beef Pho dishes, love them both! I highly recommend Pholicious if you are looking for authentic PHO.

Nope. I was super excited to see a Vietnamese restaurant  that had decent reviews. I haven't had good pho since moving from Boston MA in 2015. Long over due and have been craving some. I was extremely disappointed.  Pho is flavorless and just all around not good. My fiance got a sesame chicken dish that was greasy and covered in sauce that had no flavor at all. Service was meh..

 The spring rolls and their peanut sauce were really really good though.

It's really hard finding a good legitimate Korean/Asian/Vietnamese etc. spot in Arizona. 

So no I will not be returning to this restaurant.
Worst place ever - service was absolutely diabolical.  Never ever will go there again.  Manager was exceptionally rude!

My first review.  I'm a bit nervous.

Nice big bowl of spicy pho to cool you off on a hot day. The frosty mug of beer helped considerably. Oodles of noodles, sprouts, basil and wonderful condiments to add to your pho to make it the way I like it.

My first pho was at Cyclo - firsts are hard to forget. Pholicious is closer and it is OK.

Super delicious pho, very friendly service that goes the extra mile to make their guests feel comfortable, and wonderful atmosphere. The server brought us complimentary tea that was delicious and a nice touch. 

I only wish that the menu offered a vegetarian option, with more veggies and tofu in the broth. There were no veggie options. I also wish that the TV had not been on, as it took away from our group's discussion. 

All in all, a really great spot for pho and other Vietnamese specialties, highly recommended. The pho tasted authentic and the beef broth was rich and subtle.

How could you go wrong with a place name "Pholicious"? Many ways!  The staff was extremely nice however the service was very slow. They brought out our order individually at different times...forgivable.  NOT FORGIVABLE was the cockroach that crawled over the booth and onto my neck!  The owner or manager apologized as he handed us our bill! As we were walking out we noticed a crushed roach on the floor as well. Had we only seen it on the way in!

Let me start by saying they have absolutely horrible service. Quantity is small and pho isnt great. Especially for the price. I walked in at 820 and they said sorry were closed? There open till 9pm they just didnt want to serve us. They have done that multiple times. If you want to close early then change your store hours!. I asked for one bowl of pho for me and my girl because we weren't all that hungry and they gave us less because i asked for an extra bowl. Wtf wont come back ever again. If you want good pho try 43rd and thomas or da vang
This place was great.  I never had Pho before and it was fantastic.  Prices were reasonable, I took home leftovers.  I will be going back often.

This is the worst place for boba. They gave me a bland taro bubble tea and it was 5.49. Total waste of money. It didn't have the sweet taste of taro and it was literally just water and iced mixed with some purple coloring. Never come here!!

This is a place I always hit once a month.  I always get the Pho that has no meat, but just broth and ask them to add vegetables.  WOW!  They throw is carrots, cabbage and all sorts of stuff that gives the pho a new twist.  They do charge a little extra for changing up the plate, but its nice that they allow it.  Some places don't allow you to make changes to the dish.  Service is average, but the food brings this review definitely to four stars

Pholicious is a new vietnamese restaurant that just opened in Peoria.  I just love the name of this restaurant: PHO - [pronounced fuh, or fur] is vietnamese beef noodle soup that has existed for more than 90 years + LICIOUS - these days you can add that suffix to just about any base word and you know it is something good. 

Anyways, got a flyer in the mail for this place and being a fan of vietnamese food decided to give it a go.  We walked in to a restaurant filled with Vietnamese people.  Now this gets me excited because I know it has to be authentic and delicious.  

I ordered a cup of crab/asparagus soup - $2.95 for a cup!  And more than a generous amount. Shrimp fried rice - $7.95! Delicious, tasty, cooked to perfection.  The shrimp were not the baby shrimp, but were rather large.  D. ordered the vermicelli w/beef - $6.95!  This was an absolutely delicious dish, extremely flavorful. 

There are sooooo many things to try on this menu, the selection is huge and the prices cannot be beat.  I know we will be back soon to dine-in or order take-out.

Tried this place multiple times and came out with meh feeling. Their Pho is Americanized with the broth tasting decent to tasting like water. I had to added hoison sauce and siracha into my broth for flavor. Their Com Tam Suon Nuong is good, but as for Pho and the rest of the items on the menu; I highly recommend avoiding it (Especially their Bun Bo Hue and Ga Ca-Ri).

So delicious!! The name does it no justice. The staff are always kind. It's a really nice place to go and relax and have some really good pho!! They have excellent broth that keeps me coming back over and over. They play movies or sports on the tv which is a really nice touch. Trust me you have to try this place.

I enjoyed this restaurant. I'm a Vietnamese food newbie, and the waiter was helpful in suggesting which pho would be good for me. I and my companion both enjoyed our food. 
It's a bit hard to spot from the road, but it's a great place to eat if you're feeling like something different from Panda across the street.

I would give pholicious no stars if it was possible. More like phogusting! The chicken was dry, the Pho broth was bland, and my friend found a hair in her soup and the manager was phodiclous, making it seem like the black hair in her soup came from her red head. He was mean. Pho Tan Tann is across the street. Try there. Skip this place.

My gosh, it's been the $8 bowl of noodles streak... this apparently is the new price point when you go to newer joints with higher rents.  Had the wonton pho bowl, the individual ingredients were fresh and tasy but the broth itself was very bland.

We'll be back, but probably b/c more so of its location right across from the W. Valley Lee Lee's.

Love the pho here...let me just get that out right away.  Felt a little skimped on the meat but overall, it tasted delicious.

Now...why a 3 star rating?  A  few things...my co worker wanted to order their lunch special, they don't allow that if it's for takeout.  Ok..fine, let's pay the full price cuz he wanted the orange chicken.  Then it's an additional $1 for fried rice, a little steep but ok...he's willing to pay that too.  Then comes the moment of truth, he opens his box of Orange chicken with fried rice which he just paid $11 for, and it's so sparce we thought they might have made a mistake.  Turns out, that's just how much they give.  

While the portions on the Pho are great, they really skimped on the other food that he paid good money for.  You can get 3x the food at the Chinese place we usually go to.  So extremely disappointed with that and thus the 3 star rating.  I will definitely still be eating the Pho here, but I can guarantee no one from my work will EVER buy the Chinese food here again...

Best Pho place on the west side of Phoenix.  So why only 3 stars for the best Pho on the west side.  Easy I am from California and lived many years in Westminster AKA little Sigon. The Pho in Arizona is okay at best.  This place has a nice staff, the food comes out quickly, and the price is okay.  We eat here usually before going to Lee Lee's.  Not a bad place, just not great.

Easily the WORST Pho I've ever had! And that speaks volumes!

The broth was salty and the meat was grisly...ewwww...

I was pretty much ignored as well.

I want to like Pholicious, I really do! Partly because it's directly across the street from where I work, but after giving it 2 tries I just cannot bring myself to endorse it.

Sad really...

Second time going to this place i really liked the food but the service was not good at all there was a really young guy that was the waiter and we had to go up to him to order our food and when we were barely starting to eat our food he threw the bill at our table. They were not even busy for him to be so rude to everyone, the person next to me complained of him also.

ATTN PHO PROS: DON'T EAT HERE

I noticed the mixed reviews for this place, but decided to give it a try because it was recommended to me by a fellow Yelper.  I was surprisingly disappointed.  Here's my phonalysis:

Spring rolls: loosely wrapped and lacking flavor. It had way too much noodles stuffed in there to make the roll seem bigger. Even the peanut sauce was mediocre. I mean, how do you screw up the peanut sauce?

Broth: I was super excited when my pho came out because it was steaming and looked amazing. That is, until I tasted the broth. It was so bland, I'm not sure if they boiled any herbs. Actually, it didn't even have a beef flavor, so maybe they tossed in some boiling water and sprinkled instant pho seasoning?

Meat: Very tender and fresh, but very small portions.

Vegetables: Very fresh and perhaps the only non-disappointing thing of the night, but doesn't redeem everything else.

I'm giving this place one star for friendly service and how frequently the waitress refilled our water. I know I'm a pho snob and I'm not saying the soup was disgusting, but I would definitely NEVER come back here.  There are much better places in the valley for great pho.

I had the special of the day which was oxtail Pho and it was so good. I have not been in a restaurant that has been as clean as this one. Service was great.  I wish that I lived closer to them so they could deliver.

I hate pho. I do. I hate almost all Asian food save Malaysian, Thai and Indian. And those can be pretty interchangeable considering the former is often a hodgepodge of the latter. I find pho boring, and only eat it when I'm sick. You know this. You read Jetta R's review already.

So what's with the 5 stars, right?

I'm a skeptic to the extreme. We ordered Thai iced tea and I was very, very dissapointed (and a wee bit smug) that theirs comes right out of the can. That was all it took for me to cross my arms and begin the nay-saying. We're waiting for her General Tsao Chicken, and my Orange Chicken lunch special. Poor Jetta's puppy-dog-facing me over the table, trying to placate my snide and pessimistic predictions about the food we'd yet to be served. 

"Watch. It's going just to be plain chicken breasts with orange slices on top."

And then it came, and I shut my mouth. It was so...pretty. Fried rice shaped into a perfect little mound. Crispy chicken glistening in sweet-but-not-too-sweet-even-if-you're-super-picky-like-me sauce. And the taste. OMG. I'm a believer in Chinese food again. Chinese food from a Vietnamese restaurant. And sprinkled throughout - why yes, tiny little mandarin orange slices, cut into quarters. 

What the hell, Pholicious? Are you trying to kill me with perfection? I've got a reputation to keep. 

Maybe it was a fluke. Maybe I could still hate this place. Jetta and I returned today, me with chopsticks in hand and ready for a show down. It's on now, bitches. Kung Pao Chicken. Bring it. 

And they did, while smiling and telling my bestie she looked pretty today. Damn, they're sneaky!

And the chicken? 



...perfect. Again. Jetta's pho? Also perfect. And I HATE pho.

You win this time, Pholicious. I admit defeat. Take your 5 stars while I sulk off into the sunset. 

Can we rematch tomorrow?

Absolutely terrible. No basil (not out of basil, they actually don't even buy it for the restaurant), rotten looking bag of sprouts. A single tiny sprig of wilted cilantro. Two little packets of hoisin sauce allowed. 
I got it to go and the whole thing looked so gamey and rotten I was scared to eat it. The "beef" looked like old jerky soaked in water. 
Zero customer service, the restaurant has only been open a short while but already looks dirty and old. Owner answers the phone with "who is this?", has no interest in hearing about my experience. 
I love pho, but will never waste $7 here again. Tossed the meal in the trash to avoid potential food poisoning. The people here are not even trying, doubt it will last long.
Very good Pho. Had the #15 (tender beef) and egg rolls and both were outstanding. Will definitely be back to this place for my Pho fix.

The inconsistency of this place has lost my business. I got a glass with lipstick on it, there's layers of dust on the lights above the tables, and my wife usually gets a blended boba and now they don't blend them (as we hear and see the blender). The phó is alright but not spectacular.

This place was pretty good!  The broth in my pho wasn't as tasty as I normally like it but it was still good.  My daughter loved the pho noodles (the only thing she eats).  Service was pretty decent and I liked that they had tofu spring rolls even though the peanut sauce was just OK.  We would definitely come back here again.

I was unimpressed with pholicious because I called about 2 hours ahead and told them I would be there at a specific time to pick up my order. I called again 30 minutes before to let them know I was on my way. As I got there I had to wait another 30 minutes for my order. When it was finished it was tossed on the counter. I asked if that was my order and and was ignored. Then I signed the check and tried to give it to the cashier and he just kept walking away from me. So I checked the boxes to make sure it was my order (and it was) so I left. After I arrived to my destination and c
Was getting everyone's pho ready. The beef was completely raw. Not rare. Raw!

The bubble tea at Pholicious was so terrible it was comical.  While walking around the mall, we saw a bubble tea poster and quickly stopped for a drink.  We ordered two bubble teas prior to checking the reviews... definitely a mistake!  

In both of our drinks the tapioca balls were just terrible! More like tapioca mush that constantly got stuck in the classic oversized straw.  They were not chewy or remotely delicious.  It was as if someone had all the ingredients to make boba balls, but not the instructions on how to do it.

I'm Vietnamese and recently moved here from Seattle. 

I've been looking for a pho joint for weeks, this was my first (and last) time I'll eat here. 

The noodles were way too soggy and there was way too much noodles in the bowl. There were literally 5 slices of meat and just broth. I was given only one stem of basil and a piece of lime so small it was insignificant. 

The only good thing about my lunch was the waiter - he was polite. But maybe that's bcus I'm Vietnamese. Who knows.

Really not a review of the food since I didn't eat any....I came for lunch and was revolted by the smell when I walked through the door. Not sure if it was sewer gas or the food but it was awful.  Made a lame excuse and left quickly.

Yummy food and friendly, enthusiastic staff. I had the egg roll and pork over rice vermicelli, and Mark had the stir-fry beef with pineapple and veggies.  Both were delicious!

We also had a Vietnamese spring roll appetizer and it was both beautiful and tasted great!  Good iced Vietnamese coffee, too!

I really don't know what I was expecting from mall pho. Especially mall pho about which I'd only heard bad things. The broth was tasteless and the noodles were grossly undercooked. It was just not a good experience. I implore you,  do not do this to yourself. I only gave it two stars for the very friendly cashiers.

Do not go here unless you are looking forward to food poisoning. I ordered a mango smoothie and 4 egg rolls. The egg rolls were made of pork, chicken and carrots. They must have undercooked them, because I ended up vomiting an hour later--both the smoothie and egg rolls.

Came here right when they opened on a Saturday morning to get bubble tea! I looked at the menu ahead of time and picked avocado flavor which they also had on the list of choices in the store. However they said they didn't have it which was odd since it was right when they opened. The restaurant was really nice and clean, loved the ambiance. Employees were super nice as well and we'll be back to eat!

I'm definitely gonna be biased and say this is the best pho restaurant but then again, it's the only pho restaurant I've been to. Why look for other pho restaurants when I've found the best? Customer service is always on point. The wait is never long probably like 10 minutes at the most. Portion is a good size as well. If you've never tried pho or are looking for a new place, definitely come try pholicious :)

Okay, judging a Vietnamese restaurant on the decor is a little jaded IMHO.  Ambience is certainly a factor when dining, and if that's your most pressing criteria you're probably not fit to go into most Vietnamese places.
Pholicious does a great job with their food-went their for lunch over the weekend and tried their oxtail pho which was very good.  My buddy had chicken & vegetable chow fun which was also delicious.  Sizable portions and the most unique serving of Thai iced coffee I think I've ever had.  Almost like a half old time Italian espresso pot on top of a coffee cup that holds the coffee and condensed milk.  You're supposed to stir this then add the contents to the accompanying glass of ice.  Unlike dummy me who just dumped it in the ice :)
Watermelon boba tasted good but it was hella overpriced and there were maybe 5 boba pearls in the entire drink.

EDIT

Ok  walked in and ordered take-out.  I expected a 10/15 minute wait.  There was no one in front of me.  No during the course of' my (what would be a) 25 minute wait.  I watched several more people come in after me and be seated at different tables.

10 mins go by - everyone dining in is enjoying their refreshing canned thai teas and enjoying the apps.

15 mins go by - people are starting to get their lunchs.  I think, "Cant be long now."  Holy eff was I wrong.  The waitress comes out of the kitchen, sets food down on the table next to me and walks off.

20 mins goes by -  some random vietnamese dude walks straight in and sits at the table next to me with the food that the waitress had put down 5 minutes ago.  I know this because there was a clock right in front of my face.  The waitress then comes out and the random vietnamese dude starts bitching about his food and she takes it back into the kitchen.  At this point the chef coming rolling out and sits down in front of him with his food and starts eating it!  Turns out they're very friendly with eachother and the enitre wait staff has a good laugh.

25 mins in kids.

I have a mini meltdown when the waitress comes out of the kitchen to serve someone their pho who has just walked in like 10 mins ago.

finally got up and asked for my money back.  

At the point the waiter opened the kitchen door and said its ready.  If its fucking ready give it to me.  I was about to freak out but there were some young buff vietnamese guys there and I didnt know if I started trouble if I would just have to fight the waitstaff and kitchen help at Pholicious or if the vietnamese clientele would join in and fight me as a gang.

The dude refused my money back and handed me the bag of food that had probably been just sitting there the whole time.  What a bunch of fucktards these people at Pholicious are.  With the kitchen storage area in the dining room and your 2 gallons of shampoo from walmart.

I get the food home and I have a hungry wife and daughter.  The crab and asparagus soup sounded great and had gotten great reviews.  What the fuck yelpers?  This was nothing more than canned egg drop soup with white asparagus chunks and diced fake crab meat.  diced, fucking diced.  Thats some old school false advertising there.  Fake crab sucks balls.

I also had the sliced pork and vermicelli with chopped egg rolls.  The egg rolls had decent taste but didnt taste fresh.  Evertyhting else was dry dry bland fuckitty band.

Thanks for the overall shitty experience Pholicious.
I actually thought the decor was awesome. Staff was very friendly too. Haven't eaten yet so can't comment there
The flavor of the Pho was very good.  However, they need better utensils for consuming it.  I had the vegetarian pho, so I can't speak for the ones with meat.
Very good Pho, orange chicken was good, service was good and restaurant was clean.  Would go back.
Quick service, delicious food and comfortable ambiance. My son's favorite combination: #23 pho khong and the #76 com thit grilled pork really rice plate. It is a texture and flavor feast.
I ordered the spring rolls. The chicken tasted bad and they were not traditional. The restaurant is very dirty...it just opened and all the tables were sticky.

Well since I wasn't in the mood to cook dinner the other day and it was late by the time my bf got home from school so we decided to eat here...they were about to close in 30 minutes but they were nice and friendly about it...and didn't rush us or anything but I felt kind of bad since it look like they got everything cleaned up..but there was at least one customer still eating...haha so I didn't feel as bad.

We started off with spring rolls...well usually places give you three but here they gave two really big ones...so I guess the size makes up for the missing one? hehe eh it was pretty good though....had to add a little spicy chili sauce in the peanut sauce but other than that it was good..after all it's just spring rolls...

I ordered #15 which is pho noodles with rare slices of beef, the noodles were great...omg haven't had it for so long! it was not soggy so i had to eat it in a separate bowl to prevent it from sitting in the broth too long...the beef slices on the other hand was chewy and tough...that was disappointing. I ate mostly the noodles and soup but didn't really like the beef. My bf ordered some fried rice dish with crispy chicken which he claims is really good.  

I was mainly surprised that they have a good Pho place in Arizona....that was actually owned by Vietnamese people...most of the ones back home is owned by like Chinese people..lol Services were definitely nice..=) 

So this place....like most Pho places...closes at 9pm!

I found this restaurant by accident while I was looking for my hair stylist's new salon.  The restaurant is in a strip center, but it's hidden from sight by a bank building from the intersection, so I had never noticed it before. And am I ever glad we found it!

We started our meal with hot tea (lovely loose leaves in a delicious cup of tea) and summer rolls.  The summer rolls are my standard way to start a Vietnamese meal, and these were among the best that I've ever had.  The green ingredients were crisp and fresh, the shrimp were perfectly done (not mushy), and the peanut sauce was delicious.

We both had vermicelli dishes with grilled meats and fish sauce.  Mine had an egg roll, along with grilled shrimp and chicken.  Once again, the ingredients were all very fresh and well-prepared.  I would have liked to have had a few more veggies in the dish (maybe shredded carrots and a little more mint), but overall, it was very good.

We had the fried banana and ice cream dessert, and were pleasantly surprised by the side dish of warm coconut milk sauce that accompanied the dessert, especially when we dipped the fried banana into the dish and found multi-colored boba balls hiding in the sauce.  I'm a huge fan of boba balls, and so I'll go back to Pholicious for this dessert alone!!

We found the service to be prompt, efficient and friendly.  The owner stopped to chat, asking how we had found the restaurant, and explaining that they prepare everything fresh from the time it's ordered, and that it can sometimes cause dishes to take a little longer to prepare.  Our meal was delivered very promptly, and I didn't see anyone in the restaurant who looked like they were displeased with their food or the service.

The decor is certainly not upscale, but it is a lot nicer than some other Vietnamese restaurants I've visited in the Valley.  There's a large Buddha just inside the door, and then a large Greco-Roman statue of a goddess in the middle of the restaurant (perhaps left over from a previous owner of the space??), and of course, there was a Santa Claus on the counter...very eclectic, but fun!

We will certainly return to Pholicious again soon, and highly recommend it!

For those of us on the west/southwest end of Cuyahoga county needing a pho fix this place has come to save the day.  Located in the very center of Southpark mall - where the escalators are located - Pholicious is serving up a good quality bowl of pho.  There are some options on the type of meat you want in the broth, and they even offer a vegetable option, too.  

Spring rolls are good, and come filled with chicken and shrimp.  They offer the usual bubble tea selection.  I really love the Vietnamese coffee version.

Moderately priced, and offering great views for people watching.

My favorite thing about it may be that it's away from the main food court, so you're not dining in teenage purgatory.

Decent pho, really good boba, fast and friendly service. This is a good place to have a quick and tasty meal after shopping for Asian groceries at Lee Lee across the street. 3.5 stars for now, based on what I've tried so far. Hoping it will be bumped up to 4 after the next visit.

Just visited for the first time. My husband had a chicken vegetable dish that came in a crunchy noodle bowl. He said it was good but much preferred the spring roll dipping sauce left over from appetizers than the sauce in his dish. I took a chance and ordered a special Pho - with pork, chicken, shrimp and beef. I paid extra for the beef but boy was it worth it! It was delicious! I have food sensitivities and if they had used any MSG or anything artificial in the soup base I would have known about it! But it was all good - and amazingly flavorful to boot. You have to be patient with the servers as they have limited ability to understand special requests - but that is what I love about the authentic international cuisine restaurants - they are authentic! And they did a great job anyway - just point if you have trouble. We will be back for sure - we are now fans!

Was on travel through the area and stopped at this mall. Decided to try it out and it was a very big disappointment. The place itself was small and appeared okay. It was relatively clean and simple looking. However, the food was a different story. The pho was microwaved and the noodles were not fully cooked. It was served in a clear plastic container and was cold when first served. We gave it back and they microwaved it some more to make it hotter. I'm not a pho expert, but I've never seen it served this way (Maybe I've been sheltered, spoiled by real pho places in Atlanta and plus, never seen it offered at a mall food court). It was also super oily, probably due to the way it was prepared. When we took it back they were pretty indifferent. I think this kind of attitude shows in the food. When people don't care, how can the food be good? Basically, the pho was not edible, so we just left it there and were out $16 and went somewhere else. Should have read the reviews before trying.

My girlfriend and I eat here regularly. The staff are friendly, but they sort of just float around. The service is not very structured, so if you like a dedicated waiter/waitress and regular check-ins, you might be put off. They keep the drinks full and are quick to take your order, but they're not around every moment.   The Pho is good, but we typically get the vermicelli noodle bowls, which are large portioned and super delicious. 

The dining room is pleasant and quiet, and the prices are very reasonable. I recommend to anyone looking for a casual, quick, dinner out.

Upon entering, I thought the inside was pretty roomy and big enough for huge crowds ! As I found my seat the waiter offered me a drink and I went with a green tea and a water. After browsing through the menu I decided to go with the basic orange chicken and rice. Instead of white rice I substituted it out for fried rice. 

The food came out rather quickly! Considering there was only 3 other family's enjoying their meals. As the waiter placed down my plate I decided to go straight to the orange chicken! I wasn't disappointed and it was rather tasty! I couldn't complain about that. Now once I finished my orange chicken I went for the rice. After taking a few bites I noticed that the rice was a little dry and stale. Some pieces were harder than others....

As I went to collect my check and pay. I found out that they didn't accept American Express. Which was a downfall. So thankfully I had a little extra cash in my wallet to cover my tab.

I absolutely love this place! Their pho is so bomb and the prices are really good for all the food you can get.. the service is so welcoming and friendly. My fav pho place on this side of town by far!

Pho-aholic here. I am a pho fanatic and am extremely critical to any pho that I eat, it has to be perfect darn it! Pholicious was by far the cleaniest/prettiest pho restaurant I have ever been to. Their pho was good, but because I am a pho fanatic having lured into any place that says pho, I have to give it three stars. The flavor was good but not great. It's a nice spot to try pho, but for all us pho enthusiast it just wont fully satisfy. The service was great, everyone was very polite and nice. I would give it 3.5 stars if it was an option.

This was a first for my husband and I. It actually got us hooked on pho because we didn't know what to expect or have high expectations. I got the shrimp pho (not sure of the technical name). Tasted like an up graded ramen noodle...but it was good to me. After posting the picture my friends said it looked like fake pho and I needed to try real pho. We also got the mango bubble tea smoothie, we didn't care for it to much. Also tried the shrimp egg rolls, they were ok. The owner was real friendly and patient with us and everyone who came in. I would eat the pho here again mainly because of the cheap price, don't know about trying anything else!

The owner was extremely rude and did not even have a sign on the door to indicate if it was closed or not, he was making rude gestures toward us and I was very offended. There bubble tea was about as appealing as the Wii U is to professional gamers.

I've only been here twice but - so far so good.
1) good location, I can walk there, the parking isn't stressful if you arrive by car, NW corner of 75/cactus.
2) the server was quick, attentive and seemed really appreciative to have us as customers. Always nice to feel valued as a customer!
3) the pho - delicious, filling!
 I'll add more when we go back, we will be back!
The place is soooooo dirty. The food tastes nothing like it should at all. The pho broth was bland and the meat looked iffy- old meat. Do not waste your money here.

I used to come here regularly. But the food has been hit or miss lately. This last time I ordered fried rice and there was a thick black hair in it... embedded in the eggs!!! YUCK. 

They did get rid of that awful pine sol smell that permeated the whole place so they get stars for that. 

Service is always attentive and speedy so they get stars for that too! The pho is usually great but the last few times the broth was not as flavorful. I think it depends on what day it is. I also ordered a boba tea and the tapioca was mush. My husband who loves boba also didn't want to drink from it. 

It is kid friendly so another star for that. They do have high chairs and bring out special plates and utensils for the littles.

We kept coming back to this restaurant even after we moved, and especially after trying other mediocre Vietnamese restaurants in the valley. But I think they changed the cook or kitchen staff recently, the food is not as great as it was before. They need to rehire that cook or kitchen staff and give him / her or them a raise!
My favorite Pho  place right now , great price great service, and food is great. I get Pho with rare beef and meatball u can get double the meat for a couple extra dollars.

Here we go....
I'm always trying new Pho in the area. I actually order Mi but whatever, same thing but with egg noodles.

Anyway, I drove out here at lunch time and the place was pretty empty. There was some white guy sitting at the table next to me talking to his friend, a Vietnamese girl...I know this because he must have said Vietnam, your home town, teach me, blah blah blah...about 100 times as loud as possible. He also spoke as loudly as he could about being in marketing and her getting a job for some famous company in NYC...ugh, I wanted to leave.

Ok, that's not the fault of Pholicious so I will move on.

I ordered my usual Spring rolls and Mi.  I got the pork spring rolls and they were "ok" but the peanut sauce was so gross I thought I was going to toss cookies just looking at it. It didn't even taste like peanut and it was watery as heck.

On to the Pho (actually Mi).....it was surprisingly good. The BBQ pork was tasty, the wontons were good but the fish balls weren't that great. The broth was pretty good too. 

I don't think I'll be heading down this way again though...there is better joints in the valley.

I am rarely at a loss for words and am normally excited about writing reviews, but I really struggled with this particular one.

I really wanted to like this place! 

But like my uncomfortable experiences reprimanding a good employee for making an uncharacteristic decision, or scolding one of my children for using words unbecoming of them - this is a review that I do not relish writing.

However, as it has been often said, the show must go on! So here it is...

We were at the Oriental Grocery store across the street when we spotted this Vietnamese Restaurant. Actually, I spotted the Angry Crab, and my wife spotted Pholicious.

Angry Crab on a Friday is a dreadfully long wait, and we were both famished. So, Vietnamese it was going to be this evening!

The interior of this place is very basic. No frills, whatsoever, but we never do mind as long as the food is good.

Unfortunately, our 2 star rating indicates that it was below par, and here are the reasons why:

1) The Pho Tai, although generous in its size and portions, was comprised of what appeared to be frozen, thin pieces of some type of artificial meat that did not taste like beef. 

Typically, real beef is used, and is stewed in the broth for a prolonged period of time. That is what gives this soup its flavor. However, when I saw the very thin and evenly square pieces of beef contained within the soup, I knew that something was amiss. And when I tasted the beef, it was devoid of any familiar beef taste.

2) The Pork Chop with Over Easy Egg and White Rice was also suspect. The pork chop had good enough flavor comparable to a Korean BBQ dish, but it was so thin and had so much bone-in that it definitely evoked cheapness and low quality. This pork chop was nearly as thin as the beef that was in the Pho Tai.

3) The Curry was sweet, but lacked consistency.

4) The Egg Roll was overcooked, which resulted in the wrapping being as hard as a rock. It was so hot, that even after waiting a few minutes, it was still blistering.

The only redeeming quality was that their service is very quick (Now I know why!), and they are very friendly. 

Otherwise, this is definitely not a place that we will be returning to, unless they make improvements to the quality of their food.

I'm a huge fan of Pho and Banh Mi places, and I've been trying as many as I can. Last time I was at Concord Mills I visited Pholicious before looking them up on Yelp. Fortunately, the telltale signs of issues were right in front of me.

Walk into the cramped store and there were a few people at the counter. An ice scoop was laying directly on the counter, also a cardboard tray of bread of lying on the floor. Yes, directly on the floor near a customer table. I decided between that and the few people already in line that weren't being helped yet that I should probably try something else.

Walked back by the storefront a few minutes later and sure enough, bread still on the floor. I'll stick with my usual Pho restaurants.

Do yourself a favor if you're thinking of visiting this place, go to Cabarrus Health Alliance's inspection page a look them up. It appears that safe food handling has been a problem for them since opening.

Loved it! I had the Bun Bo Hue and the pork sausage spring roll.  They put fried wonton skin in the spring roll and it gave it a wonderful crunch.  The Bun Bo Hue was good but it was missing the pork hock but otherwise it was tasty.  The place was nice and clean.  When I'm in Peoria, AZ again I will be here.

Regarding the Pho Ga: My boyfriend felt the broth was bland and has definitely had better.

I did not feel like ordering one of the few tofu with vegetables dishes towards the back of the menu. Craving a vermicelli noodle bowl, I requested that my bowl's egg rolls be veggie. My server looked me straight in the eye and said "Ok". I also ordered a side of peanut sauce. He said, "do you want tofu, too?". That should have been my first clue he did not understand my order. My veggie egg roll vermicelli bowl came... with MEAT in it. I explained the mix up and my server offered to box it up several times. What part of "I don't eat meat" was getting lost in translation here?! I ended up eating a rice noodle and lettuce spring roll and becoming ravenous again 30 minutes later.

We were back in our old neighborhood and decided to stop in for a bowl of pho. We heard that this restaurant was under new management and hat the food wasn't the same. Um, no! The food is just as great and even better. There was a hearty serving of chicken in my pho and they were happy to provide extra sliced jalapeños and lime.  This place is still my favorite PHO  Place in town!
Best pho I've ever had!  The servers could be a little more attentive but over all love this place
I went there today because we wanted pho and that was the nearest place to go to after running errands and the place is clean. The food was decent.

I go to a lot of pho places and this place is alright! Nothing too special about it, i only come here because its close by.

Their pho broth isnt as refreshing as other pho places but still good

Yummy, it's so good! The chicken soup is good but they changed the color from white to light brown with a slightly different accepting taste. I think they use beef broth with chicken but still tastes good.

After many visits, I feel it's time to give them a review! I mostly come here for the Pho...but I do enjoy other things on the menu(Love their spring rolls!). Pholicious has good Pho, good prices and the staff is always friendly here.

My first visit. I have been seeking authentic or close enough to authentic Vietnamese food in AZ. So....I am STILL looking. Anyways, I enjoyed the Pho Tai here, yet I prefer the broth to be savory prior to me adding the condiments: hoison, Siracha, lime and typical Vietnamese garnishments. I did enjoy the temperature of the Pho it was super HOT like I like it. Portion was very good. Restaurant is clean and friendly. When I initially walked in, only a few tables were occupied with other customers and I wasn't sure if I seat myself or walk up to the register to inquire. No one greeted me, so I walked to the register to inquire and was then seated, from then it took approximately 10 minutes before I was asked if I would like anything.  I'm on the fence with my rating 3.5 to 4. from the service, but for the food it is maybe a 4 after I adjusted to my taste. I will for sure be back again. Although, the service was slow it was friendly. So I can overlook this, but hopefully future visits it is more welcoming. :)

Service is good, with a friendly staff. The ambience is great with TV's hanging from the ceiling for your viewing pleasure. Unfortunately the noodles in my hubby's Pho were clumpy, and the beef had no taste. I ordered shrimp with fried rice and it was awful, so salty, but maybe that's how it's supposed to taste.

When your partner's least favorite kind of food is your most favorite kind of food, you have to pick and choose your battles.

For me, this means only suggesting Asian cuisine when Misty S is a) not feeling good, b) not feeling Yardhouse, or c) not paying. 

All of these scenarios have one thing in common; they rarely ever happen.

But alas, as chance would have it, Misty S and I both came down with something over the holidays.

Thus, I began my attack.

"Let's get some pho."

"I hate pho."

"It'll make you feel better."

"No thanks. I don't like pho."

"Oh wow, you know what sounds really good right now? A big bowl of soup. Hot, steaming soup. Oh man, Ci Ci's has soup! All the chicken soup you can eat, and pizza too! Snap, chicken soup and jalapeno pizza! We'll be good in no time!"

"Fine, we'll do Pho."

Ironically, when we pulled into Pholicious we saw what may have at one point been a greasy child-infested Ci Ci's, now closed to the world like a tomb. A graveyard of all-you-can-eat-awfulness.

Walking inside, I could literally feel the steam off of other people's bowls. It was like a sriracha flavored sauna. Out of the corner of my eye I saw a gentleman drinking coconut juice right out of the fruit itself. And waiters carried around massive bowls of noodles and stuff and other stuff. 

For a moment I felt that I had found my perfect restaurant.

And that's when I panicked.

For it is practically written in the cosmos that the more I love an Asian restaurant, the more likely Misty S will find it lacking. 

See Also: Wong's
See Also: Dragon Garden Express
See Also: Any Chinese Buffet....ever.

One of the many joys in dining-in at any Asian restaurant (sushi included) is that I'm not expected to actually pronounce any of the items from the menu. That's why there's all the numbers.

Whenever I go for Mexican or Italian the waiter looks at me like I'm a tool if my pronunciation's off and corrects me before having a good laugh at it.

Oh, thank you, JEFF, for imparting your SUPERIOR knowledge of the Italian language onto me. Here, before you leave, can you make sure I'm pronouncing this correctly...

Vaffunculo e muoia! Now bring the check, I'm going to the Olive Garden.

I ordered the #2 (spring roll), and the #40 (egg noodle soup with barbeque pork, prawns, quail egg, and something something).

The spring roll was deceptively delicious for a bunch of shrimp, rice, and veggies rolled up in cold rice paper. It came with a nice thick peanut sauce that was topped with peanuts. I love it when there are multiple forms of the same ingredient in a dish. It's so aesthetically pleasing from a deconstructivist standpoint. Blah blah blah, pretentious bullshit, blah blah blah.

Before my number 40 came out, Misty's #10 (crab and asparagus soup) was served, and Misty invited me to take part of her soup. It was warm, eggy and soft. Almost with a hint of sweetness, I thought. Light, subtle, and very white. 

Satie, one of my favorite composers, used to eat "white food" so that he could get into the mood to compose "white music".

This is what you learn at art school.

My number 40 was awesome. Simply awesome. Spicy, sweet, sour, noodly and meaty. It even came with a side of bean sprouts and chili peppers that I could throw into the soup myself. It was like hot pot but much cheaper and without me screaming at the top of my lungs if someone could please pass me the fucking fish balls. 

The soup was so good that even after all the noodles and meat were gone I still sat there, sucking down broth by the spoonful. Misty tried several times to coach me on the proper way to hold the porcelain spoon, but alas, I make as proper a lady as I did a boy back in the day. C'est la vie, I guess.

After all the sriracha and peppers I had added, the broth was so spicy that my nose was running and my eyes were watering. I looked like I had just been cut from the Rocky Horror cast and yet I still sucked that soup like I've never had it so good. 

The waiter came by and took away the broth while I was trying to cool off with some ice. I remember thinking "awww man, I wasn't done with that" but aftewards feeling grateful that I was being inadvertantly saved from myself.

I feel like I've got a sniffle coming on. Maybe if I wait it out a bit I can do my sad puppy face routine long enough that Misty gives in and takes me back to Pholicious again soon.

(After learning I was writing this review, Misty would like to remind me and inform all of you that she doesn't hate ALL Asian food. She's particular to Malay and Indian food, but can't stand all that "panda express" nonsense I gorge myself on. Surprisingly, I don't mind being the tacky and tasteless one in the relationship.)

Yelp wants me to write a big long thing about this place, but it is simply gooooooooooooooood. The meat is high quality and noodles are perfectly cooked. It is also cool that they have ABC Family on the televisions, which is my favorite channel, but they are willing to change the channel to like a sports game if you ask them. Service is always very kind and considerate, which seems to be a rarity these days.

either vietnamese food in phoenix is not the same as vietnamese food in nyc, dc, and boston, or this place is just not that great. overall i would just say i wasn't impressed with it. what i am used to is getting some fresh, raw veggies on the side (carrot, cucumber, watercress, herbs, etc.) and this place doesn't do that. i asked for it and i got steamed veggies instead. yuck. also the bo luc lac should be tenderloin and the quality wasn't so good (but the price reflected this). oh well.

I'm not very picky with my food and I usually give four stars to pho restaurants. However, I would never recommend this place to anyone.

I went to Pholicious with two other friends. We ordered two entrees of chow fun (beef and chicken), one hot and sour soup, one bowl of pho, one diet coke, and a Thai tea with boba. The chow fun noodles weren't thoroughly cooked. The hot and sour soup was extremely salty. The owner didn't bring out the vegetables until my friend was halfway done with her pho. We assumed that the vegetables cost extra so we didn't bother them.

There was a fly at our table during our entire stay. I'm sure the owners noticed since we were swatting at the fly, but they did nothing to get rid of it. The fly managed to touch our soup and vegetables. It was pretty disgusting.

The diet coke was flat and it didn't taste right. Finally, the boba in the Thai tea were frozen and it was not edible.

Our bill was around $38 with tax. I only made one complaint to the owner. I didn't want to embarrass the owner or create a scene. I told him that the boba was not edible. He took 50 cents off our bill. Thank goodness!

I managed to get the entire Thai tea off the bill. Still, I wasted $35+$2 tip on this place.

1st time here. We had spring rolls to start. Love them. Then I had a bun bowl; one of my favorites.  The pork looked  a little different than usual, but I totally enjoyed it. It had just the right combo of lettuce noodles pork sprouts cucumber and herbs. My husband ordered a shrimp dish with wide noodles.  He  really enjoyed it. This is the closest vietnamese place to home. We will be back.  

We have been back several times now and get the same great service and food.

I admit I was a tad nervous to try this place out since I read a few of the recent reviews. I always take yelper opinions into account, but I do like to give a business the benefit of the doubt - and in this case I'm glad I did!

Now I'm no pho expert, but I just wanted pho SO badly the other day and said F@#! IT let's try a new place! I ordered the pho with rare beef slices and brisket. OH. MY. Not only did it satisfy my pho craving, it instantly became my new favorite pho place so far. I can't wait to try more menu items and will certainly come back with an update!

Literally the best fried rice from any Vietnamese, Thai, or Chinese restaurant I've gotten in the Phoenix valley.  Their egg rolls could have been better though, and the lettuce that came with them should have been thrown out the day before. The wonton soup was also very good.

When we were in AZ for our mini vacay, we relied heavily on Yelp for our meals.  My kids really wanted to eat Pho after a day of eating burgers and pizza.  We chose Pholicious just for its name.  The name is quite daring, isnt it? Being from So. Cal, we are quite spoiled when it comes to good Vietnamese food espcially Pho.  I really didnt expect much from this place.  I ordered their special clear noodle soup, pho bo for my son.  My DH ordered stir fried crunchy egg noodles and eggrolls for appetizer.  I didnt care for my noodle soup.  The broth was bland, not flavorful.  I could taste the MSG but I cant be positive.  It just didnt taste right.  I couldnt even finish half of the bowl.  Their eggrolls were ok, better than expected.  DH finished his dish, but he could be very hungry because he also finished my noodle soup.  i would rate this place 4 stars for its cleaniness and very good service.  The food only received 2.5 stars.  I rounded it up to 3 taking their service into consideration.

We came here after a hearty attempt at an escape room. Fairly unassuming, we were greeted enthusiastically when we entered. I decided to get some pho and the yellow curry for take home. The pho was good. Plenty of meat, lots of seasonings, it was a delightful end to the day.

The next day the curry was fine. It wasn't spectacular, but I certainly enjoyed it.

Great friendly service, very pleasant and clean atmosphere. I ordered the pho tai (beef soup) and it came well presented and very tasty. My girlfriend attempted to order pho chay (veggie soup) but they did not have it on the menu. The server compromised and brought out a very poor bowl of soup with hardly a variety of veggies, just mushrooms and tofu over beef broth and of course the rice noodles. This place has potential but they need to add a pho chay on the menu and get rid of the disposable chop sticks and use plastic ones like in all the good Vietnamese restaurants. There are plenty of other good Vietnamese restaurants to enjoy, just not this one.

Been here total of three times, last time was because the Vietnamese place I frequent happens to be closed. Ordered their pho with everything in it. The taste of the broth was like it was made from an instant broth pho packet...blah. Service was quick.

Fresh food, perfect portions, always fast and friendly service all for a very reasonable price.  My husband and I are regulars here.  We start with an order of egg rolls and usually order some stir fry with veggies (#36).  They have good boba selection also.

Tried this place out for first time since we've been here in AZ for 2 years. Coming from California there are so many amazing PHO places we didn't think AZ would have the same.
What a pleasant surprise! Great friendly knowledgable service. Fresh pho with amazing flavor. We went there for lunch and ordered from the menu. The waiter kid came back to offer us the same thing we ordered except from the lunch special menu so we'd get a drink and save 2 bucks! I was impressed! 
Went back a few days later and had same great experience.  Love this place!!
Not one bad thing to say about this place! Will definitely be frequenting! Spring rolls were delish and so was the Pho
Located inside Concord Mills, not very expensive, & friendly staff. So far I've tried the Pho beef bowl & the Vietnamese Special Sandwich. Both tasted great to me.
This is absolutely one of my worst dining experiences. Nothing is authentic  about this place. I ordered  Beef Pho. It was terrible!!! Slow service and poorly managed.

The chicken pho arrived very hot which was perfect. There were plenty of toppings; scallions, cilantro. Lots of chicken. 
Egg rolls- very nicely balanced flavor. I was able to taste the ingredients separately. 
Bun thit nuong - pork was lean, I asked for extra cucumbers and no mint. It arrived how I asked for it. Some places use hot noodles, which is gross, so I specified cold noodles.
Music-traditional Vietnamese
It wasn't busy, and our server never came to check on us. 
The floor was dirty by my table. Straw and chopstick on floor.
Overall, the food was great, and I will return when I am in the area.
Had a large Pho Tai with raw beef. Absolutely delicious best pho I've had in the PHX area

Veggie broth IS NOT VEGGIE IT IS CHICKEN. sanitation rate is 91.5, disgusting. Owner always sits in the corner and doesn't help. This place uses food from the day before and they just reheat it in the microwave, the shrimp in the spring rolls are expired.

Ok, so I am going to start off by saying; This is a small Pho restaurant in the middle of South Park Mall here in Strongsville, OH. So I will review it as such. 

I am, a Pho enthusiast. I must admit that I love Pho from every angle and I haven't had a Pho disappointment during my time on this earth. The main thing I judge my Pho experience on is, the broth and the after effects. Meaning, will I be sweaty?, will I feel strengthened and energetic? I like to joke and classify Pho as an anti-depressant, because it does just exactly that; Makes you feel better, sometimes great.

Enough about me though, let's get to Pholicious. I'll start off with the management, which is a middle-aged gentleman who is very friendly and talkative, but not too talkative if you know what I mean. No one wants someone there asking you questions while trying to enjoy a meal, so he knows his boundaries which I highly appreciate. The rest of the staff always seems to be the same as far as who is working, 2 young lovely ladies that are extremely polite and helpful. 

So let's get to the Pho; It's way better than what you would expect from a "fast food" type joint in the middle of a suburban mall. The helpings are a very good size, not too much and not too little. They offer an arrangement of Beef, Chicken, Shrimp, Vegetarian and Fish Balls. They also offer Spring Rolls and Bubble Tea which I have yet to try. I usually just go with the beef, or sometimes shrimp added to it. 

They offer the typical condiments you would see at a Pho joint, none of which I ever use. They are there if you must though, Sriracha, Hoisin and so on. I prefer Pho naked, except for the plated ingredients given, which consist of Jalapeños, Bean Sprout and Lime. Just recently I had learned that they do offer fresh Basil upon request, which made me very happy. I can see why they don't just give it to you off the bat, because I am sure there are many suburbanites that waste it. So it's very understandable why they do, what they do here.

Let's talk about the broth and what stands out with it. The first thing you get is Ginger, Coriander and Salt. Yes, their Pho is a tad on the salty side, but it will not detour you from returning. The end result, is me sweating and feeling awesome, and I always have leftovers which is another plus.

So with all that said, if you are at the mall on a hardcore shopping spree and need that extra boost; Then stop by Pholicious for a wonderful bowl of Pho. I highly recommend it!

I was delighted to see something new in the Concord Mills food court when I was there running errands the other day. I am a fan of Pho, but was in a weird mood and wanted some veggies in my soup.  

Pretty sure it was the owner sitting to the side, and he overheard my request for vegetables. The girl at the counter didn't seem to know what to do. I ended up ordering the chicken and vegetable Pho.  I only wanted a regular size, but realize she was already given me the large without asking, so pay attention to that. When I opened my large cup it was not filled to the top- check out the photo.  Wondering if that was on purpose or not.  

The soup base was pretty good, and the veggies were OK, as well as the noodles. The chicken was clearly microwave grilled chicken, and that kind of grossed me out. As another reviewer mentioned, my cilantro was also a bit wilted.  

 For mall food,  it was decent, but I won't be running back. They had other things and I did see that they have a Bahn mi, which I wouldn't mind trying. They had a ton of varieties of Pho.

It's mall food, what else can I say?
Pholicious is a true mom & pop shop in Concord Mills unlike all the other chains around the outlet mall. It smells delicious as you walk by so I had to try it out.

Overall, the place is pretty decent. I like that they also serve various types of boba tea. My biggest complaint: I wish they had some (Thai) basil at least.

It's unfair to compare against dedicated shops in OC, California.

This review may not even be fair to the restaurant.  This being my first Vietnamese food all I can comment on is what I liked without being able to compare it to other Vietnamese restaurants.  Until Yelp I was under the false impression that Vietnamese food was too hot and spicy for my tastes so I never even tried it, certainly not the way it was served to me. 

I ordered the vegetarian spring rolls ($3.00) and Pho with beef brisket and meatballs ($7.25).  The wrapping on the spring rolls was labeled as rice paper.  It was similar to the wrapping I didn't care for on some of the dumplings at Dim Sum so I guess I either need to develop a taste for it or find something else on the menu.  I think part of the filling was rice noodles and I didn't care for them cold either.  The sauce was, I think, Hoisin based with some chopped peanuts.  It was pretty good as is and I left it alone because I wanted to sample the entire meal the way it comes.  I think I would add a light splash of fish sauce and another of red pepper sauce, both of which were at the table.  I normally do not order appetizers because the entree is more than enough to fill me up but this time I am thinking I am just getting a bowl of soup.  This is probably no surprise to most of you, I have bowls this size in my kitchen, I use them as serving bowls when feeding multiple people family style.  At this point I wish I was with somebody who knew the ropes better than I.  I wasn't sure whether the bean sprouts and stuff that came on a separate plate were supposed to be tossed in the soup or eaten off the plate they came on, I tossed them in the soup.  I am no stranger to chop sticks but rice noodles have got to be the hardest thing I have ever eaten with them.  I am sure there is a better way than I was handling it and I must have been the source of some humor for the staff as about halfway through one of them quietly laid a fork on the table.  Other than spooning the broth out towards the end I finished the meal with chop sticks.  I did not care for the meat balls but I tend to not like pork in any meat ball.  However Pho has won me over like it seems to have every one else.

The restaurant was not very busy.  The Asians occupying a few tables on one side and me, seated in the far corner (the host's choice).  The basketball game was on the tv and all of the staff were following it.  Even though not a sports venue I was fine with this as that is about all I think a tv is good for.  Definitely a family run affair, one corner of the dining room had been set up with a laptop and I could see what looked like homework type stuff near the computer.  I was greeted and seated immediately upon entering.  and as I got up to leave my server came over and thanked me for coming in.

I wouldn't mind coming here again and I will add Vietnamese to my list of acceptable cuisines.

Pholicious is a new Vietnamese restaurant located in the heart of SouthPark Mall. It occupies the area where Caribou Coffee used to be, right next to the central escalators. They pretty much focus on serving pho, though they also serve goi cuon (fresh shrimp roll) and fried rolls.  They also become the first place in South Park to serve bubble tea (at least since Cali Juice left, but theirs sucked anyway). They offer your standard bowl of pho with your choice of meat, with combined meats at an additional cost. They provide bar seating, serve their pho in real dinnerware instead of disposable, and they bus the dishes when you're finished. 

This is a concept that, while not new to more culturally diverse areas of the country, is fairly foreign to suburban Ohio. Pho inside a mall? I was curious but reluctant to try. Given what it is, I did not have high expectations, but they exceeded them by a mile and earned a fan. I had the "regular" size pho with beef and beef balls. It was small, but everything tasted fantastic. The broth was exceptional. The beef was served rare (as it should be), and the beef balls were just right. I thought they could have provided more bean sprouts and noodles. Besides that, it was a delicious bowl of pho. I would probably opt for the large size next time since the regular wasn't really filling. The honeydew bubble tea smoothie also passed the test. The boba wasn't perfect and there wasn't much of it in there, but overall, it was delicious and will definitely suffice if you want some bubble tea while shopping. 

I definitely recommend this place to pho noobs and pho connaisseurs  (phonnaisseurs?) alike. This is not your typical mall food. The pricing is competitive with other Vietnamese restaurants, so at $7-8 per meal, it might be more than what you'd pay at the food court, but you're getting a different product. While not quite on par with the more popular pho restaurants downtown, it's easily a step above the Asian eateries in the mall and is actually authentic. So if orange chicken just isn't cutting it, look no phurther than Pholicious phor your pho phix. Yeah, I just did that. I'll see myself out.

Its convenient, fast, and cool coz its in the mall, but lets get real! Portion size to price is ridic! Way overpriced for fast food pho. The broth tastes pretty decent though! Great idea. Could improve on customer service skills a little though. All in all if ur craving it, go for it, closest pho place away is about 15 mins away.

Had lunch there on a Friday afternoon, they had 4 other tables.  The place is clean and service was ok.  I had the egg rolls, bun with bbq pork, and soy milk.  The egg rolls were crispy but I did not like the insides.  It was missing the meat portion for the extra taste.  The bun with bbq pork was ok too.  The noodles were very cold (normally it should be room temp.) and the pork slices were so thin.  I have not found a GREAT PHO place yet on the West side.

My husband and I were hopeful for their bubble tea since it's so close to us, but we were sadly disappointed.
