I had the coconut and my husband had the taro and it was the worst we've had and we have had a lot of bubble tea coming from NYC. It was basically like having chopped ice with no flavoring at all so save your $5!

Read all the reviews first and save yourself some time and money. Ok so I have been craving Pho for two months and was excited to see a Pho place in the mall. Well my excitement was short lived. This place was terrible. I'm not sure if they really know what Pho is. I will not be eating here again and wish I could give zero stars.

This place has very great food!!! But the service kind of stinks!! Every time we come in it feels like forever until we're given menus. Then sometimes they help other people that JUST walk in, instead of keeping the order that people arrive in. Food great, subpar service. The young woman that works there is a very hard worker though. She's running around while the other helper stays behind the register. I applaud her!!

Was really craving some Pho, came across the place.
Good food at good prices! I got the plain pho in beef broth and added veggies, and the bowl was HUGE! The service was good as well, will definitely be returning if we are ever on that side of town!

I've done it; it took 2 months(!) but I've finally found a decent pho spot in Phoenix.

Background: Originally from the Bay Area, love pho (regular spots are Turtle Tower in SF, Pho Kim Long in San Jose), spending 3 months in Phoenix for work. First thing I do in a new area is scope out the good eats, especially a pho spot to help cure any hangovers. 

The good: 
Atmosphere is small and friendly, service and cleanliness is above average. 

I ordered #14, which is the standard beef combo with all the fixins (steak, brisket, tripe, tendon, beef ball). The soup is flavorful and seasoned well. The accouterments are fresh and clean, and the noodles were standard. I have never seen it before, but they add black pepper to the soup which added to the flavor. 

Price was $11 for pho and coffee, which seems very standard.

The bad: 
There is only one size available, which is unusual. If you are especially hungry (I was not), I would recommend an appetizer or ask for a large (but I'm not sure if they would accommodate this since I didn't try). I felt a little skimped on meat, and there was barely any tripe (which I love), but once again, I'm fairly sure you can pay more for extras/large. 

My coffee was super sugary, more like condensed milk with a spot of coffee.
Next time I will ask for the milk on the side. 


Summary: 
So yes, mission accomplished, this spot makes the grade. 
When I went up to pay, I did noticed they had gotten 3 "A" health inspection ratings, which is always a good thing to see.

If you haven't noticed, the yelp reviews for some of the other pho spots are all glowing (4 to 5 stars), but I don't feel they are accurate at all. This place is strong 3.5 stars; will be going there again.

I love the pho here and just don't understand the bad reviews. I used to get the chicken pho, but yes it lacked a little flavor, so if you're a meat eater, don't skimp and get the pho with tender beef. The broth is so rich and delicious and veggies so fresh. I also recommend banh xeo (#5 on the appetizers)
Worst pho ever. Threw it out after two bites only had chicken and noodles in it. Don't waste your money especially if your use to authentic pho

Mehh...A-OK. I've been here multiple times for the past several years, and I'm not sure why..The pho is alright, don't like the taste as much as some other places I've tried. The service is not good, and the prices are higher than most. 

The restaurant itself looks pretty nice and clean, and parking is always convenient. There's never too many people when I go, but the food is just alright..

Well I had high hopes for this restaurant. The boba was awesome. However I got my order to go and that could've been part of the problem. My food was lukewarm and I was not very satisfied with my Pho. The Mongolian beef was good but sort of bland. 

I probably will not be coming back here.

I have a new Pho restaurant! Staff was very friendly, all smiles, attentive and accommodating to my news. I ordered the Sping Rolls, Beef Soap with extra beef, and a diet. 

What can I say? The food was delicious! I learned from the server (who spoke English) that they put Ginseng in the broth...Nice touch! Very healthy! After all that, I didn't feel to full, yet was satisfied. 

I'm definitely coming back here again!

I really like Pholicious. It is not my favorite pho in the valley, but it is my favorite close to me where I can get take out from. We usually get it 1-2xs a week. The price is right and the people are always friendly. If you are in the area, I would give it a shot.
Thin and crispy chicken on #77 delicious . I swapped out the white rice for fried rice.  While a little dry, it had a good flavor. Excellent service,  fair prices.
great place to have pho after shopping across the street for groceries, the ambience is nice and the food is very tasty.

My girlfriend and I came here after finding a place close to our house. She's a little inexperienced with Vietnamese food, so I was hoping it would be something she liked so we could come here often, as I am a huge fan of Vietnamese cuisine. Hands down best I've found in the valley. She had #54, I had #52. EXCELLENT is an understatement! We'll become regulars, I'm sure!

The first time I tried the sandwich. It was The worst Vietnamese sandwich (banh mi) that I've ever ate. It's not real banh mi. The bread is not crispy. It is just like the American bread that you eat with the hotdog, very soft. Even I saw her toast it, but when She gave it to me, it was cold, feel nothing warm like you just take out from the oven. I have to say this kind of sandwich shouldn't be considered Banh Mi. 
The second time I bought the Vietnamese coffee with price $3.99, and the total after tax is $4.31. I paid by my credit card. I didn't know they was cheating so I just tossed the receipt. Now, I check my bank and see Pholicious charged me $6.00 even. BE AWARE. NEVER BUY ANYTHING AT THIS CHEATING SMALL STORE AGAIN!!!!!!!

Soooo..... here's the story.  I'm in the nail salon getting a mani-pedi.  Haven't eaten since the night before because i was too damn lazy to make anything, and my friend wants to go shopping...  We decide to grab a bite and Pholicious is on the way from toes to shoe store.

We enter the empty dining room and are seated in the corner near an edge.  Weirdest mix of music i have ever heard... Christmas music and pop tunes... but it's the beginning of March.  The service is waaaaay too slow. 

We I order Pho and spring rolls.  My friend orders something with pork and some other kind of roll.  I think they called it a summer roll.  Mine was good.  Hers was so bad that we split the rest of mine.

Other than the weird music and slow service, my lunch would have been ok.  If we had gone off what my friend had, I'd NEVER go back.

The service was so slow that we never had time to go shoe shopping.
I ate there when it first opened. Had a bowl of that pho crap. no one including the manager could translate the menu for us. Terrible.

I absolutely LOVE this place! I go here all the time and I have never had a bad experience. I once brought my family here for my Mom's birthday and the owner gave my Mom a free margarita! I've brought friends along before too and they all enjoyed the pho. I highly recommend Pholicious.

Good honest pricing. Good food good service. 
We ordered for take out, which is awkward with all the parts of a Pho Bowl, but it was ready on time and service was friendly.

Really dirty. I wanted- no NEEDED, veggie pho but they didn't have any which turned out to be a blessing in disguise because I really believe I may not have survived this dining experience. They literally keep their bean sprouts in a box on the floor. Crusty countertop, layers of fingerprints on the glass... just a neglected feeling and an accident waiting to happen. I would think the mall would regulate where the health department has failed. I got a salad next door at the smoothie /build a salad place and it didn't make me sick so that's a positive. I hope these guys make some much needed improvements because good pho at the mall would be epic.
Food is yum. Price is awesome.  First time here and we will be back.  Everything fresh!!  Service was awesome!  Come enjoy. Nom nom nom.

Vermicelli dishes have great portion compared to other places here in the valley. 

The broth for the pho tastes fresh and they have a good amount of options.

Like any pho place should be service is quick. Getting food out doesn't take long and we had a party of 6. I definitely will be back to this place.

It is a little awkward when you walk in, not sure if you seat yourself or you get seated. I think either or will work here.

There is a yogurt place inside too. Didn't try it. But some of my friends say its okay. 

Definitely one of your cleaner pho options intown as well.

I usually get a take-out since my husband doesn't like Pho.
I've noticed that broth is better if you get it to go. Whenever I eat it there, broth seem very greasy. You can just see the layer of oil covering the top of soup. 
Servers are nice, but slow. They tend to forget drinks and food order. Take forever to get refill, more time to get check. Just like what Derek R said, I've also seen people walk in after me yet have food out in less than a minute. So they do have their "favorites" for sure.

My best suggestion is call in for take out, you'll get best food and service that way.

Fresh, fresh, fresh...I had #53 (I think it was) that was some greenery shredded up with carrots and beef slices on top - delicious!
I had to ask the waiter for help, because I didn't know the foods there.  Went with his recommendation and wasn't disappointed that's for sure!
Going back for sure to Pholicious!  Good service, good food and super fresh.
And, for those people who want to sit and talk, met a friend there and we sat and talked for almost 3 hours without anyone bothering us.  Loved it!

Given the almost non-existent variety of pho options in the north Glendale/Phoenix area, Pholicious ranks above many (ahem Avina- vomit) to fulfill your hungover cure of beef noodle broth cravings.

The restaurant is clean, the service is fast, and the food is slightly above average, it's not as disappointing as fellow reviewers claim it to be. Noodles are nicely al dente and the broth isn't as MSG-ed out or excessively oily like other places. Prices range from $6-10, a fair price to pay for their decent sized portions. I hear their duck pho is one of the best. Me? I've had the pho tai and was well satisfied. Stick with any the noodle soups and you'll be good to go (rice dishes are a little stingy).

An extra bonus: it's conveniently located across the street from Lee Lees for all your Asian shopping needs.
Wasn't too bad. First time having pho & I couldn't complain. Also got the coffee boba & it wasn't too good. The tapioca was weird.

I have never had Pho anywhere else, so my review doesn't compare this place to any other pho restaurant. 

I'm addicted to this place! I had pho for the first time a few months ago and I loved it at first taste! The environment is quiet and clean, the staff are always friendly, and the Pho is amazing. The coolest thing is, that they always have a good movie on, or one of the local sports teams playing on their two tv's. I try and come less than once per month, but that never happens.  If you're in the area and you love pho, then this is a must stop!!

The space was previously a Verizon retailer. It's very cramped and with what little space they did have, it would be too small for more than 3 customers at a time. 

I decided to skip ordering pho this time around and just purchased lychee and mango bubble teas. The mango had a strange powder mix. (I know other pho joint uses powder mixes but this one in particular tasted off) The lychee is sweet as it should be but it tasted like a can of Yeo Lychee drink poured over crushed ice. Not as well blended as the mango which appeared to look like a real smoothie. 

Overall, it's okay. Not my go to choice but if you want bubble tea and willing to sacrifice just to get something cold, then why not? Just don't have too much expectations.

The prices were just right the broth was amazing in my pho, and it didn't cost me that much for extra noodles, and shrimp. I definitely will come back, and try their other dishes that sounded excellent as I went through their menu.

I love Vietnamese food. Especially good Pho. Luckily Pholicious has really good pho. Located on a corner of a strip mall,  Pholicious always clean and the staff friendly.  We always order Pho which is good and reasonably priced. Service has always good and the other menu items look good. Been here several times and will come back soon.

Decent pho restaurant. 

My first time at this place was during a cold rainy day with my sister.  We were very intrigued with the place and when we walked in it was quite busy. 

To make a long story short, their customer service was not up to par.  Like most experiences I've had at Vietnamese restaurants that are small and busy, they try to get you out as fast as they can which is normal.  So we don't mind how fast the service is but in this case, you barely got any attention. We had to ask them for a table and waited at least over 20 mins to get our order in, including our drinks.    Now, as for the food, my sister had the chicken pho and I had the pho tai (sliced steak).  Overall, good decent pho.  Broth was light, not extremely flavored but still ok and wasn't super oily which we both like.

Overall, it was a good enough to satisfy the craving since we are originally from California and it's far from home pho but definitely will try another time.

I had been going back to this place for a few months because the new owner/chef makes better food than the previous one.  But, that's about to change...  After a month-long out of town trip, I came back today and the food seems to be more expensive, the pho does not taste the same anymore, and they also messed up on the pho order.  When told about it, they didn't even attempt to fix it - there are missing items in my order and I got charged full price for it.  Definitely will switch back to Tan Thanh across the street for more or less the same food quality at a much better price.

The best Pho in Glendale/Peoria. Very reasonable prices and excellent menu selection!
4/5 stars being that the communication is still a bit difficult at times between guests and staff

5 stars for AZ that is :)

Best Pho restaurant I found  while visiting...hands down...Place is great, customer service is excellent and their spring rolls are amazing :)

Super stoked to fly out to visit family and have this only a couple miles from their home :)

I shall return next time I'm in AZ!!!

Looked at menu and decided to get bubble tea smoothies. Listed as one of the options for smoothie was Vietnamese coffee flavor. So I ordered Vietnamese coffee smoothie. I inquired at least three times to make sure this was a smoothie. My husband ordered the blueberry smoothie and wanted blueberry popping pearls. We verified that it would come with blueberry flavored popping pearls. When we received our drinks mine was not a smoothie but a cup filled with ice all the way to the top and filled with maybe 4 ounces of coffee. My husbands blueberry smoothie was not blended all the way and had huge chunks of ice and strawberry flavored pearls because they ran out of blueberry and failed to tell us. This is a terrible first experience and unfortunately for them we will not be returning. I will stick to going to places like Yoghut

I have to say you can't go wrong with Phö, but you definitely can't go wrong with XL size Phö! We love our Phö spicy, flavorful, with fresh ingredients and Pholicious was on point. My daughter got the beef and flank and I ordered the #55 beef brisket Phö. The broth didn't need my help I could've had it as served. Lots of flavors that hit the spot. My wife ordered a beef and broccoli dinner and I must say the immediate smell was awesome. I personally do not enjoy most Asian cuisine due to harshness on my stomach. However I tried her plate and I was very surprised. The beef taste great not chewy and wasn't oily like most places. The fresh garlic, cilantro  and broccoli was flavor popping and of course fresh cooked rice is always good! 

Oh and don't forget the Thai tea. Delicious and refreshing!

nem nuong cuon and mi dac biet.. order those, and be happy.

nem nuong cuon: is a spring roll with grilled pork, one of my favs that they do an excellent job of preparing here, make sure you ask for the sauce.

mi dac biet: an egg noodle soup with all the fixin's amazing

also try the vietnamese iced coffee.. it will not disappoint

The food is all decently priced. The pho portions are huge and delicious. I would recommend the combo pho and the mango boba! The staff is friendly and the place is over all clean. It's a four star this time because some of the meat had hard pieces in it which I had not previously experienced here.

I had the regular size beef pho, maybe three cups or so. It was more than adequate for a mid-day snack. Taste was a bit salty, and I had to add a some things to make the spice to my liking, but it was good. The service was very good.  They have tables, but also seats at the "bar."

This place is in the food court of the mall. It is not a restaurant type setting, adjust your expectations on that ahead of time and you will see that this place is great. Food tastes great and staff is nice. Price is about right.

My wife and I just went here for the first time. It was really good. When we were dating we went to a few places in the east valley and were looking for some good pho and we think we found our place in the NW valley. We tried Nam Sao, but did not care for their pho; and Pho Avina was closed when we went on Sunday. This is across the street from the oriental market we go to each week so we plan on going again.

My first impressions are how much fresh vegetables are in the broth when they bring the bowl to you and the smell of the broth. Both passed my eye and nose test right off. Good amount of green onion, white onion, and cilantro already in the bowl, and the meat was still pink when it came to the table. The broth had good flavor before adding any condiments. We both had the rare beef and meat balls. After adding the basil, bean sprouts, lime and hot sauce we dug in and we really enjoyed our meal. We plan on going some time for lunch so we can also try their coffee.

I would recommend Pholicious if you are on the NW side of town and looking for a good meal.

This was my go to Vietnamese restaurant for pho and rice plates not because it's my favorite but because of convenience. Pho Avina is closer to me but that place is terrible so I end up going to this place. It also helps that LeeLee Supermarket is one street over so I get a Viet fix and my Asian needs shopping in one trip. The pho and com tam is average. The service is fast and friendly enough. I do find it a big stingy that they don't bring out the bowl of broth/soup before you get your rice plate unless you ask for it. 

All in all this place is fine if you just want an average meal; nothing to rave about here. If I felt like driving farther, I'd definitely hit up Pho Van in Chandler for pho or Com Tam Thuan Kieu in Mesa for com tam.

Haven't found "magnificent" Pho in the PHX area yet, Pholicious has a very descent pho with great pricing, excellent service from what seems to be a family owned restaurant. Haven't had a bad experience at this place yet.

I must say this was a weird experience coming here. We walk into the restaurant listening to Jump Street 21 with them cussing and everything. We sat down ordered our food and drinks (raspberry iced tea and Thai tea). We got our spring rolls out then waited for the food. As we are continuing to wait for our food we are still waiting for our drinks. So I finally get up to ask the guy where our drinks are, he states that they are out of raspberry iced tea and that the Thai tea is being made (after 20 minutes of waiting). They were too busy watching 21 Jump Street then being on customer service. Once we get our food they bring the drinks, the soda had a bug in it and the Thai tea was really nasty, not sweet, no ice and not that much boboa. This was the first and last time that I would ever visit this place. The nice thing was that the flavor of the Pho was good but the service was crap!!!

They tried so hard to be modern and chic and...and well they just failed. The neon lights, non-matching granite and marble, bad sky mural on ceiling, two flat screens on opposite walls on different channels with the volume up on low but loud enough to be heard no matter where in the restaurant you sat.
The servers were not friendly. They weren't rude or anything there just wasn't a sense of welcomeness.
The food was pretty good, but the shrimp was just ever so slightly over cooked. But everything was pretty flavorful.

Pho and taro boba was really good (I got pho with rare beef) just small portions and only one size.  older man came to check on us and see how we were doing, which was nice.  The only bad thing was he had some young girl which I assume was his daughter on the register and she added up wrong and over charged us and then took our card again and double charged us.  They voided the over charge but it won't go back on our card for a couple days.  My kids got orange chicken which they didn't like and wouldn't eat it.  I suggest paying cash there and not getting orange chicken.  I think his business would do better if he hired someone good with people or didn't have the kids there running it.

Had the chicken Pho and Thai iced tea, everything was fresh and well made. A little bit of a language barrier with the wait the wait staff but the menu is easy to order off of. The place itself is quiet than most with a TV on playing a movie channel (Ted 2 was on at the time). Would eat here again, a local gem!

One of the best Vietnamese restaurants in Phoenix, this place is acids the street fro LeiLei's and hidden from view. Don't miss it. Try the chicken wings and especially the grapes leaves. The staff are very nice. The ambiance is wanting and music dated, but this is a must.
First time having Pho! The staff was friendly and helpful! I ordered to-go. Everything was delicious and came with all the traditional sides/garnishes. We'll definitely be back!

We want to try out this restaurant for the first time. We try the shrimp roll and banh mi. Shrimp roll was good. Banh mi wasn't good at all. Have to give 3 star's just for that. But customer service was great...
Not my favorite go to places ... the broth smelled old but was good kinda ... had a really horrible smell but the boba tea was good. I wouldn't want to go there again tho

Comfortably decorated. Not foo foo but well coordinated. 40 chairs. Ordered number 14 pho beef noodle. Asked for two bowls. The pho bowl may have held 1 half gallon. I also ordered a jackfruit smoothie with bona. Restrooms were clean. Prices were great.
Most flavorful Pho in town. The vegetable and tofu Pho is excellent. Lunch specials M -F.

I'm from the Bay Area where we have some very great Vietnamese joints so I'm kinda bias when it comes to other places.  We went there for brunch on a Monday and there was just one other table eating pho. 

The pho broth was good.  The spring (fresh) rolls were average.  The wrapper could have been softer.  The coffee was nice and strong and they make it for you at the counter so none of that fresh drip at your table.  

Overall, the place is clean.  The food was good, but one minus on them was that they are a bit on the pricier side!  If I'm back in town, I'll be back.

Pho?  In a mall??  How could this be???  This is the real deal, trust me here. 

This was a great experience.  They aren't in the food court like you'd expect, and are tucked away in the center at the bottom level.  They have a bar and tables, incredibly friendly service, and the pho was exactly what I needed amidst hectic holiday shopping on a freezing Ohio day.  I would absolutely return.
I love their Boba (Bubble Tea), especially the Thai Tea and Vietnamese Coffee but they also have Vietnamese Noodles.

I want to make it clear that this was my first time eating Pho. Despite having nothing to reference it to, the food was very good and I had a very enjoyable first experience. 

There were so many options and additions available you would be hard pressed not to enjoy it. My rating will be four stars because I can't knock them points for my lack of experience and I don't feel I can award five stars because I have nothing to compare it to.

Food was decent but the owner is the most unfriendly person ever.  Never greets you, never smile.  Blah to you too.  


Pho was ok

Vermicelli plates didn't smell too good.  Not sure what it is.

Pho in a mall?? What the heck? I was intrigued, since I've never heard of such a concept before.  So I decided to try it.  They don't have much of a selection, since the stall is small, but they focus on pho, boba drinks, and appetizer rolls.  Their goi cuon is freshly made in front of you, so it's pretty good.  The drinks were pretty good though, but I couldn't really taste the mint in the my mint tea boba.  The pho comes in several varieties, but no pho special.  Each pho bowl comes in two sizes, small or large.  Large is the size of a regular bowl at any pho restaurant, and small is about 3/5 the size of a large.  You don't get much in the way of veggies for you pho, but it's only a stall so it's no biggie.  My only complaint with the pho is that there's no "marriage" of flavors between the noodles and the broth.  If you eat pho a lot you would know what I mean.  The noodles taste like noodles, and the broth taste like broth.  The noodles aren't soaked wit hte flavor of the broth.  But it's a stall, so I'm not really complaining.  If it was a restaurant, this would be a problem.  Overall, it's a pleasant experience.  They have mints for after your meal and punch cards for a 10th meal free.  I'll be back, but I won't go out of my way.  It's 4 stars for a stall, but 3 stars if this was a restaurant.

Do not order the spring rolls. The pork in it tastes and feels like cardboard. The other spring rolls have a very gritty aftertaste. To me it looked like kitty litter. It pho was ok, but overall it was very disappointing. The whole bill was overpriced for the crappy food. Will not be going back.

Oddly, this is a fast food place in the middle of the mall on the first floor (not in the food court like you would expect). They have their own seating which is nice to not have to fight the crowd on a Saturday afternoon.

We ordered the beef and beef meatballs pho, shrimp and chicken pho, spring rolls (which should really be called summer rolls as spring rolls are fried and summer rolls have the soft rice paper). Everything was quite tasty shockingly for coming out within 10 minutes. Tip: fresh Thai basil is free upon request.

The downside to this place is the price and portions. I understand that being in a suburb, pho is hard to find. However, also being "mall fast food", I wouldn't consider the ambiance/environment gourmet either. For 7ish dollars for regular size pho and 8ish dollars for a large bowl, the portions were very small for pho. Regular was like an American size soup bowl and the large bowl was like a pho regular/small size bowl at other places. The summer rolls were almost $6 for only 2 and almost $5 for the Thai ice bubble tea. Overall, this lunch for 2 came to over $33!  Pretty unheard of for a Vietnamese place. However, it is nice to see a Pho place in the suburbs.

If you're in the need for a "pho-fix" then this place isn't bad to stop in to. I am a big fan of pho, and it is a great food to eat for anytime of the year. Pholicious gives you one standard size of pho... It comes in a big bowl (which is fine by me - the more the better) but the both isn't as savory as I expect it to be. Pho is a very savory, smooth, tasteful broth that has hints of bone marrow and is amazing, but I just taste regular beef broth in this. They also keep all of their silverware piled together in a container at the end of the table, so it is safe to say that other people's hands have most likely touched your soup spoons before you have. They also give you wooden chopsticks to use, which are pretty weak and the moisture from the pho causes little pieces of wood to fall off into your soup. The staff is very friendly, and the food is out pretty fast. The prices are amazing!! Like I said, I only stop here if we are further away from other pho places, but it's not terrible.... Just mediocre.
I am on the most ridiculous diet and they cater to my strange requests. Super friendly staff and top notch food!

Here right now eating rice noodles with grilled pork and egg roll. The pork must be old because it tastes awful, has a funky smell to it. It tastes like old meat, could very well be since they close in about an hour and this is left over meat? What a disappointment and waste of money. I should have ordered my usual but wanted to try something new. What happens.

A solid Vietnamese joint. Period.  Its not the most authentic but it gets the job done!
